type EntityObject = class inherit StructuralObject interface IEntityWithKey interface IEntityWithChangeTracker interface IEntityWithRelationships

Docs.summary: Base class for entity types that are generated by the Entity Data Model tools.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member this.EntityKey : System.Data.EntityKey with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the key for this object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Object Services uses the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityWithKey.EntityKey%2A> property to manage objects in the object context.
You cannot set the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityObject.EntityKey%2A> property after an object is attached to an <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectContext>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property EntityState As EntityState
public: property System::Data::EntityState EntityState { System::Data::EntityState get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the entity state of the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When an object is attached to the object context, either as the result of a query or by calling <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectContext.Attach%2A>, the <xref:System.Data.EntityState> becomes <xref:System.Data.EntityState.Unchanged>.
When an object is detached from the object context, it returns to the <xref:System.Data.EntityState.Detached> state.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override sealed void ReportPropertyChanged (string property);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void ReportPropertyChanged(string property) cil managed
Protected Overrides NotOverridable Sub ReportPropertyChanged (property As String)

Docs.param: The name of the changed property.
Docs.summary: Notifies the change tracker that a property has changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When an entity type is generated by the Entity Data Model tools, the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityObject.ReportPropertyChanged%2A> method is called after a property change to commit the cached value in the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityChangeTracker> as the original value of the property.
This method calls the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityChangeTracker.EntityMemberChanged%2A> method in the change tracker.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override sealed void ReportPropertyChanging (string property);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void ReportPropertyChanging(string property) cil managed
Protected Overrides NotOverridable Sub ReportPropertyChanging (property As String)

Docs.param: The name of the changing property.
Docs.summary: Notifies the change tracker that a property change is pending.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When an entity type is generated by the Entity Data Model tools, the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityObject.ReportPropertyChanging%2A> method is called before a property change to cache the current value of the property in the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityChangeTracker> so that this value can be used as the original value for the property.
This method calls the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityChangeTracker.EntityMemberChanging%2A> method in the change tracker.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityWithChangeTracker.SetChangeTracker(class System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityChangeTracker changeTracker) cil managed
Sub SetChangeTracker (changeTracker As IEntityChangeTracker) Implements IEntityWithChangeTracker.SetChangeTracker

Docs.param: Reference to the change tracker that is used to report property changes.
Docs.summary: Specifies the instance of that is used to report property changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called by Object Services to specify the instance of <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityChangeTracker> for the object to use to track changes. This is typically called when the entity is added to or removed from an <xref:System.Data.Objects.ObjectContext>.

MemberSignature.Value: ReadOnly Property RelationshipManager As RelationshipManager Implements IEntityWithRelationships.RelationshipManager

Docs.summary: Gets the relationship manager used by this object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityObject.System%23Data%23Objects%23DataClasses%23IEntityWithRelationships%23RelationshipManager%2A> returns a <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager> used by this object. Object Services uses the relationship manager to provide access to related objects.
Classes that expose relationships must implement this property by constructing and setting <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager> in their constructor. The implementation of this property should use the static method <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager.Create%2A> to create a new <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager> when needed. After being created, it is expected that this object will be stored on the entity and will be provided through this property.
